intro: Pimpinella angustifolia, commonly known as narrowleaf cowparsnip, is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescence and aromatic foliage. It is a biennial or perennial herb that typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and stream banks. The plant features finely divided, lance-shaped leaves and small white flowers arranged in compound umbels. Its stems are often hairy and can reach heights of up to 1.5 meters. The fruit is a dry, two-lobed schizocarp that splits into two separate mericarps when mature.
